thread.title: Vigil set to remember 'Man Man,' Norristown boy who died in fire trying to save dad
thread.title_full: Vigil set to remember 'Man Man,' Norristown boy who died in fire trying to save dad

author: Julie Shaw
title: Vigil set to remember 'Man Man,' Norristown boy who died in fire trying to save dad
text:
Vigil set to remember 'Man Man,' Norristown boy who died in fire trying to save dad Updated: January 17, 2017 — 2:52 PM EST 705 Share Submitted photo Sanford "Man Man" Harling III, 12, died in February 2016 after he ran into his burning home in Norristown to try to save his father, Sanford Harling Jr., who was trapped upstairs. He didn't realize his 58-year-old father had jumped from a second-floor window to safety. Julie Shaw Staff writer 
Julie Shaw works on the Real Time News Desk for the Inquirer and the Daily News. During her 10-plus years at both papers, she has covered the courts, crime, immigration, and census stories. More by Julie Shaw Arrow icon 
A candlelight vigil for a 12-year-old Norristown boy who lost his life in a fire at his family's home will be held Feb. 5, the one-year anniversary of his death. 
Sanford Harling III, nicknamed "Man Man," had rushed back into the family's home on the 1000 block of Markley Street about 9 a.m. Feb. 5, 2016, to save his father, Sanford Harling Jr., who was recovering from hip-replacement surgery. 
He didn't realize his 58-year-old father had jumped from a second-floor window to safety. Man Man, a seventh-grader at Lakeside School in North Wales who helped feed the homeless and played football with the Norristown Youth Eagles football team, never made it out. 
At about 5 p.m. Sunday, Feb. 5, family members and friends of the 12-year-old boy will gather in front of the family's former home to remember him at a candlelight vigil and to release balloons. Members of the community are invited to attend and are asked to bring a candle and balloon. Published: January 17, 2017 — 2:52 PM EST The Philadelphia Inquirer
